FOUND IN: The Battle of the Alamo was a pivotal event during the Texas Revolution, fought from February 23 to March 6, 1836, when a small group of Texas rebels, including famous figures such as Davy Crockett and Jim Bowie, defended their position against a much larger Mexican army led by General Santa Anna
Gargoyle (a stone carving that often has a grotesque or monstrous appearance)
